alert.note: Alert for Sedgwick County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 2:47PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Sedgwick County through 315 PM MDT... At 246 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout tornado 4 miles east of Marks Butte, or 13 miles southwest of Julesburg, moving northwest at 45 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ovid, Sedgwick and Marks Butte. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
